subject: Communication
title: The Caucus: Private Conversations in Mediation
description: A quick, practical guide to The Caucus: Private Conversations in Mediation.

hook.text: The mediator calls a break and speaks to each side privately. In ten minutes, a deadlock that lasted hours dissolves.

buildup.text: A caucus is a private, confidential session between the mediator and one party during a mediation process.

discovery.text: People say things in private they won't say in front of the other party â€” fears, real interests, flexibility.

twist.text: Caucuses are controversial. Some mediators avoid them because they can create suspicion about what was said privately.

climax.text: Used skillfully, caucuses unlock hidden flexibility. Used poorly, they breed distrust.

punchline.text: Sometimes resolution starts with a private conversation.

quiz.question: What is a caucus in mediation?
options: A private session between mediator and one party
